column4: so does anybody here know anythign about x11 port forwarding?
I'm looking to remote desktop into my ubuntu server from my ubuntu laptop.
I have ssh working with key authentication no problem.
I can even use the -X tag and run gedit and firefox remotely.
I would like to know how to get the remote desktop to show in a window.
its realy fast especialy over the internet
i think you could query the display chooser but doing the whole desktop using ssh x11 forwarding might be dog slow, as i said it use nxserver from nomachine
its realy fast and it tunnels the whole traffic though ssh
i think there is freenx in the repos no idea how well that works, i allways use the debian packages from nomachine.com, but i would asume that freenx works too
you need to install the server on your server and the client component on your laptop
whats the error message and whats your setup?
the error says that the connection was not probided by any settings service.....when I go to the network config -> VPN connections
sure the stuff you entered there is correct? i never use that networmnagager thing, it never worked for me

I'm not too sure...my server is a clearOS server, but it seems like to config would be on the client side. I really don't have any idea what I should have as far as a config is concerned, or even where it should be.
do you have any files to connect to it? usualy youll have a config file and certificates

it is pretty simple from what I read. the server system gave me options to download the key, the certification, and all that stuff. there was even a config file that I downloaded but it was a .ovpn file....i put them into /etc/openvpn after I did sudo apt-get install openvpn on the client.
what configuration did you do in networkmanagers vpn thing?
